Detailed Description

A Viewport is the view through which a camera sees a scene.

It can have a fixed position and dimension, or can change its position and dimension when the size of the canvas using it changes. It is compatible with OpenGL.

See also:
Cam
Author:
Ben Constable, original Java code by Oli Winks
Version:
1.0

void Viewport::onCanvasChanged ( int  width,
int  height 
)

Called when the canvas changes size/position.

If this Viewport is not fixes, the change in the canvas will affect the position/dimensions of this Viewport.

Parameters:
widthcanvas width
heightcanvas height
Viewport& Viewport::operator= ( const Viewport &  rhs )

Parameters:
rhsViewport to copy from
Returns:
this
void Viewport::setTo ( bool  fixed,
const Vec2 &  pos,
const Vec2 &  dim 
)

Sets this Viewport to the given parameters.

If fixed is false, the Viewport will resize itself as the canvas resizes, and the parameters will be used as percentages of the canvas parameters. This means that they must be between 0 and 1. onCanvasChanged must also be called straight after this in order to recalculate the position and dimensions.

Parameters:
fixedwhether or not this Viewport has fixed dimensions/position
posposition (% relative to canvas if fixed = false)
dimdimension (% relative to canvas if fixed = false)
